quiz.title: Unit 4: Forces (Quiz 9)
quiz.subtitle: Synthesis and Advanced Multi-Concept Problems (20 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics
quiz.topic: Complex Force Systems and Integrated Applications

questions.question: Why does mass affect terminal velocity?
options: More mass means more air resistance needed
questions.explanation: Heavier objects need more air resistance to balance their greater weight.

questions.question: A 10 kg block slides down 30° incline with μₖ = 0.2. What is acceleration?
What is the purpose of free-body diagrams?
questions.explanation: Free-body diagrams show all forces acting on a single object.

questions.question: A 70 kg person in elevator reads 630 N. What is elevator doing?
questions.explanation: Weight = 686 N, scale reads less, so accelerating down. N = m(g-a) → 630 = 70(9.8-a) → a = 0.8 m/s² down.

questions.question: Why can tiny thrusters maneuver large spacecraft?
questions.explanation: Even small forces produce acceleration in frictionless space (F=ma).

questions.question: A 0.2 kg ball thrown at 25 m/s is caught in 0.04 s. What average force on catcher?
What is the normal force direction?
questions.explanation: Normal force is always perpendicular (normal) to the surface.

questions.question: A 800 kg car needs 40 m to stop from 20 m/s. What is friction force?
Why do brakes work better on dry roads?
questions.explanation: Dry conditions maintain high friction coefficient between tires and road.

questions.question: A 5 kg and 3 kg mass hang on pulley. What is system acceleration?
A 1500 kg car takes a banked curve of radius 80 m at 25 m/s without friction. What banking angle is needed?
A 2 kg block rests on a 5 kg block. Coefficient of friction between blocks is 0.4. What maximum force can be applied to lower block without upper block slipping?
questions.explanation: Maximum acceleration without slipping = μg = 0.4×9.8 = 3.92 m/s². Maximum force = (2+5)×3.92 = 27.4 N

questions.question: A 0.5 kg object is whirled in a vertical circle of radius 1 m at 6 m/s. What is tension at the bottom?
A 100 kg crate is pulled with 600 N at 40° above horizontal. If μₖ = 0.25, what is acceleration?
A 2000 kg elevator carries 500 kg load. Cable can withstand 30,000 N. What maximum upward acceleration?
A 0.8 kg object on a spring oscillates with period 1.2 s. What is spring constant?
A 50 kg box is pushed up 20° incline with 400 N parallel to incline. If μₖ = 0.3, what is acceleration?
A 1200 kg car tows 800 kg trailer. Car engine produces 4000 N force. What is hitch force?
questions.explanation: Total mass = 2000 kg, a = 4000/2000 = 2 m/s², Hitch force on trailer = 800×2 = 1600 N

questions.question: A 5 kg object experiences F = 20 - 2t (N). What is its acceleration at t = 3 s?
A 0.2 kg baseball reaches 40 m/s from rest over 1.2 m. What average force was applied?

scoreMessages.90: Exceptional! You have mastered complex force systems and multi-concept synthesis.
scoreMessages.70: Excellent work! You handle advanced problems well; review oscillatory motion and variable forces.
scoreMessages.50: Good foundation. Focus on practicing connected systems and multi-step force analysis.
scoreMessages.0: Keep practicing! Review Newton's Laws and work systematically through complex scenarios.
